tit.cmt: or steamed egg hotchpotch→(steamed egg hotchpotch)としました。

sen.j: 茶碗蒸し（ちゃわんむし）は、日本料理の一種。
sen.e: Chawan-mushi is one of Japanese cuisines.
Chawan-mushi is one of the Japanese cuisines.
sen.cmt: one of→one of theとしました。
sen.e: Chawan-mushi is one of the Japanese cuisines.

sen.j: 円筒状の茶碗にミツバ・干し椎茸・ギンナン・ユリ根・蒲鉾（主に板蒲鉾）・鶏肉・魚肉・エビ・アナゴ・貝などの具材と、溶き卵に薄味の出し汁を合わせたものを入れ、蒸し器で蒸す。
sen.e: When you cook Chawan-mushi, you put all ingredients such as mitsuba (Japanese honewort), dried shiitake (mushroom), ginkgo nuts, lily bulbs, slices of kamaboko (boiled fish paste) (mainly ita-kamaboko (fish paste on a wooden board)), some pieces of chicken and fish meat, shrimp, conger eel, and shell into a cylindrical bowl, pour beaten egg mixed with bland soup, and steam it in a steam cooker.

When you cook Chawan-mushi, you put all ingredients such as mitsuba (Japanese honewort), dried shiitake (mushroom), ginkgo nuts, lily bulbs, slices of kamaboko (boiled fish paste) (mainly ita-kamaboko (fish paste on a wooden board)), some pieces of chicken and fish meat, shrimp, conger eel, and shell into a cylindrical bowl, pour beaten egg mixed with bland soup, and steam it in a steam cooker.

When you cook Chawan-mushi, you put all ingredients such as mitsuba (Japanese honewort), dried shiitake (mushroom), ginkgo nuts, lily bulbs, slices of kamaboko (boiled fish paste) (mainly ita-kamaboko (fish paste on a wooden board)), some pieces of chicken and fish meat, shrimp, conger eel, and shell into a cylindrical bowl, pour beaten egg mixed with bland soup, and steam it in a steam cooker.

sen.j: 蒸し器の蓋はずらして乾いた布巾を挟んでおく。
sen.e: Slide the lid of the steam cooker a little and tuck a dry fukin (dish towel) between the cooker and the lid.
Slide the lid of the steam cooker a little and tuck a dry fukin (dish towel) between the cooker and the lid.
Slide the lid of the steam cooker a little and tuck a dry fukin (dish towel) between the cooker and the lid.

sen.j: このとき蒸し時間が長いと、卵が凝固し過ぎて隙間（鬆）ができる。
sen.e: When it is steamed for too long, it gets bubbles in it as egg becomes too hard.
When it is steamed for too long, it gets bubbles in it as egg becomes too hard.
When it is steamed for too long, it gets bubbles in it as egg becomes too hard.

sen.j: マイタケを生のまま入れるとプロテアーゼ（タンパク質分解酵素）の作用で卵が凝固しなくなるので、火を通してから入れる。
sen.e: When raw maitake mushroom (fan-shaped mushroom with multiple layers) is used as an ingredient, it prevents egg from setting by the effect of protease (proteolytic enzyme), so put it after it is boiled.

When raw maitake mushroom (fan-shaped mushroom with multiple layers) is used as an ingredient, it prevents egg from setting by the effect of protease (proteolytic enzyme), so put it after it is boiled.

When raw maitake mushroom (fan-shaped mushroom with multiple layers) is used as an ingredient, it prevents egg from setting by the effect of protease (proteolytic enzyme), so put it after it is boiled.

sen.j: 夏場には冷やして上に冷たいダシをはり、冬場には熱いままで供される。
sen.e: Chawan-mushi is served cooled with chilled dashi broth soup over it in summer and it is served hot in winter.
Chawan-mushi is served cooled with chilled dashi broth soup over it in summer and it is served hot in winter.
Chawan-mushi is served cooled with chilled dashi broth soup over it in summer and it is served hot in winter.

sen.j: バリエーションとして、茶碗蒸しの具にうどんを加えたものを小田巻き（苧環）蒸し（うどんおだまきうどん）、具に豆腐を使い、蒸しあげた後に上から葛あんをかけたものを空也蒸しという。
sen.e: There are two variations of Chawan-mushi: Odamaki-mushi, a traditional egg custard dish on a base of udon noodles (Japanese wheat noodle) mixed with ingredients of Chawan-mushi, and Kuyamushi (steamed egg custard with tofu (bean curd) in it) poured kuzu paste sauce (a sweet sauce whose main ingredient is arrowroot starch seasoned with soy sauce and sugar) after it is steamed.

There are two variations of Chawan-mushi: Odamaki-mushi, a traditional egg custard dish on a base of udon noodles (Japanese wheat noodle) mixed with ingredients of Chawan-mushi, and Kuyamushi (steamed egg custard with tofu (bean curd) in it) on which kuzu paste sauce (a sweet sauce whose main ingredient is arrowroot starch seasoned with soy sauce and sugar) is poured after it is steamed.
sen.cmt: poured kuzu paste sauce→on which kizu paste sause is pouredとしました。
sen.e: There are two variations of Chawan-mushi: Odamaki-mushi, a traditional egg custard dish on a base of udon noodles (Japanese wheat noodle) mixed with ingredients of Chawan-mushi, and Kuyamushi (steamed egg custard with tofu (bean curd) in it) on which kuzu paste sauce (a sweet sauce whose main ingredient is arrowroot starch seasoned with soy sauce and sugar) is poured after it is steamed.

sen.j: テレビドラマ「古畑任三郎」の主人公の得意料理。
sen.e: This cuisine is the specialty of Ninzaburo FURUHATA, a character of popular TV drama.
This cuisine is the specialty of Ninzaburo FURUHATA, a character of popular TV drama.
This cuisine is the specialty of Ninzaburo FURUHATA, a character of popular TV drama.

sen.j: 鹿児島弁で「茶碗蒸しの唄」が存在する。
sen.e: There is a "Song of Chawan-mushi" in Kagoshima dialect.
There is a 'Song of Chawan-mushi' in Kagoshima dialect.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: There is a 'Song of Chawan-mushi' in Kagoshima dialect.

sen.j: 青森県や北海道の一部ではクリの甘露煮が入っている。
sen.e: Chawan-mushi in Aomori prefecture or a part of Hokkaido has chestnuts stewed in syrup in it.
Chawan-mushi in Aomori Prefecture or a part of Hokkaido has chestnuts stewed in syrup in it.
sen.cmt: prefectureの頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: Chawan-mushi in Aomori Prefecture or a part of Hokkaido has chestnuts stewed in syrup in it.
